properties.address: 322, High Road, Ilford, Essex IG11QP
properties.description: Situated in the heart of Ilford for over 200 years, our church family comes from all over the world and we celebrate being a family that welcomes diverse cultures and languages. We have a wide range of facilities for children, parents and all age adults irrespective of religion, age or ethnicity. A daily offering of a welcoming atmosphere, with free hot drinks and biscuits! * Knitting Group – Mondays at 10.30am: make friends, drink tea and coffee as you knit. * Young at Heart – Mondays at 1pm – meet people for chat, games, friendship refreshments and faith. * FRIENDSHIP CAFÉ – our weekly Tuesday and Wednesday morning coffee morning. Free refreshments, board games and relaxing chat. * English Classes (Language Link) – supporting women and men to learn English. Women - Wednesdays & Thursdays 10am-12pm. Men - Thursdays & Fridays 10am-12pm. * The Welcome Project – supporting and restoring the dignity of homeless women and men by a range of services in our purpose built centre.
properties.title: Ilford High Road Baptist Church

properties.address: St. Andrews Church, London E11 1JD
properties.description: Offering a free three course meal on the third Monday of every month, 5.30pm. Soul Food Community Meal was started by St Andrew’s Church, Upper Leytonstone and Leytonstone Mutual Aid, but has evolved and is now run by the community, for the community. It is a space where people can belong, which reaches past the simplicity of being a welcoming space. People of different faiths, and of none; of different ages; of varying needs and complexities – all come together as a community that cares for one another, supports one another, and simply wants to spend time together. We are more than a project – we are the Soul Food Community.

properties.address: The Renewal Programme, London E12 6PG
properties.description: The Renewal Programme have launched their Stay Warm in Newham project and have opened their first warm bank on Tuesday 24th January 2023. Newham residents are encouraged to attend our warm bank sessions to access energy- related advice/services and activities, to help reduce energy cost. We also provide a welcoming space for residents to enjoy tea and coffee with some company. Our warm bank runs three days a week on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Fridays from 11:00am- 1:00pm at The Renewal Programme, 395 High Street North E12 6PG. You will have the opportunity to engage with our energy experts, Groundwork’s Green Doctors, who will be there every Tuesday to offer advice to residents on how to reduce energy cost while keeping their home warm. They also provide in-depth referrals via telephone calls or home visits (subject to eligibility). We are also providing hot meals every Wednesdays from 11:30am- 1:00pm and will be running a chess club for anyone who is interested to learn! Everyone in Newham is welcome!
properties.title: Warm Bank

properties.address: Greenwich Leisure Ltd, London SE18 6DL
properties.description: In a prime riverside location Waterfront Leisure Centre is a fantastic multi-use community sport and leisure facility located in the heart of Woolwich, SE18. It boasts a modern newly refurbished 150 plus station gym with the latest Technogym cardiovascular, strength and resistance machines. A new functional fitness area is the perfect place for a HIIT work out and two further studios host a wide variety of Fitness Classes for all ages and abilities. This includes a multi purpose black out studio for interactive group cycle and yoga classes. The centre has a 25m fitness pool and a leisure pool with slides and a wave machine, sauna and Jacuzzi making it the perfect place for all your water activities including our Better Swim School lessons, aqua aerobics, fitness swims and family sessions. Facilities available for hire include a multi-use sports hall, indoor 5-a-side pitch and squash courts. Waterfront Leisure Centre is conveniently located, only a short walk from Woolwich DLR Station and the new Elizabeth Line Tube Station. There are excellent road, bus and train links from Greenwich, Charlton, Blackheath, Plumstead, Belvedere and Erith and Kent. We look forward to welcoming you very soon.
properties.title: Waterfront Leisure Centre

properties.title: Bromley Salvation Army

properties.address: 20 Widmore Rd, BR1 1RY
properties.description: The church is open most weekdays for users who hire rooms and the public has access to the vestibule at those times. Bromley Homeless and the Bromley Food Bank (open for referrals on Tuesdays and Thursdays) both have permanent space on the premises. We run a cafe for refreshments (teas, coffees, biscuits, cake) on Tuesdays and Wednesdays from 10.00 am to 12 noon. The cost of a hot drink is £1 and biscuits etc are 50p.
